questions.q: A client 12 weeks pregnant comes to the emergency department with abdominal cramping and moderate vaginal bleeding. Speculum exams reveals 2-3 cm dilatation, the nurse would document these findings as which of the following
questions.explanation: Imminent abortion also called spontaneous abortion is the death of the fetus before it can even survive. The most common symptom of miscarriage is vaginal bleeding with or without pain

questions.q: Indomethacin can be used in the treatment of polyhydramnios. What class of drug is it?
questions.explanation: Indomethacin is an NSAID

questions.q: Which of these is not a risk factor of uterine rupture?
questions.explanation: Macrosomia, a short delivery interval and maternal age >40 years old have all been shown to increase the risk of uterine rupture. Obstetric cholestasis has not been shown to increase the risk of uterine rupture

questions.q: In the most common form of shoulder dystocia, what does the anterior fetal shoulder become impacted against?
questions.explanation: The anterior fetal shoulder is impacted by the pubic symphysis

questions.q: Which of the following is not a risk factor of VTE?
questions.explanation: Hyperemesis gravidarum is not a risk factor for VTE

questions.q: Which of the following is not a recognised symptom of uterine fibroid?
questions.explanation: Uterine fibroid can rarely present with acute pelvic pain but do not present with cyclical pain

questions.q: Which point during pregnancy carries the greatest risk for VTE?
questions.explanation: The risk of VTE in pregnancy is caused by changes in levels of proteins in the clotting cascade. These changes are more pronounced as pregnancy progresses, with the highest risk of VTE occurring in the post-partum period

questions.q: Which of these is a significant risk factor for miscarriage?
questions.explanation: Increased maternal age is a strong risk factor for miscarriage due to the increase number of chromosomally abnormal ova

questions.q: What is the usual first line therapy in lichen sclerosis?
questions.explanation: The underlying etiology of lichens sclerosis is thought to be autoimmune so the first line treatment is topical immunosuppression through steroid creams e.g clobetasol propionate

questions.q: What is primary dysmenorrhea?
questions.A: Menstrual pain that occurs in the menopause
questions.B: Menstrual pain with no underlying pelvic pathology
questions.C: Menstrual pain with an identifiable cause
questions.D: Excessive menstrual loss which interferes with a woman’s quality of life
questions.explanation: Primary dysmenorrhea is menstrual pain with no underlying pelvic pathology

questions.q: What is the standard initial treatment for iron deficiency anemia?
questions.explanation: Oral iron supplementation is the first line management of iron deficiency anemia

questions.q: Which of the following is not a risk factor for anemia in pregnancy?
questions.explanation: DM is not a risk factor for anemia in pregnancy

questions.q: Which of the following is the greatest risk factor for uterine rupture?
questions.explanation: Previous uterine surgery is a risk factor for uterine rupture but previous cesarean section is a stronger risk factor

questions.q: Which of the following is not a common symptom of cervical ectropion?
questions.explanation: Cervical ectropion is most commonly asymptomatic. It occasionally presents with post coital bleeding and others but does not typically cause painful periods

questions.q: Which of the following surgical procedures are used to treat heavy menstrual bleeding without an attributable cause?
questions.explanation: Myomectomy and uterine artery embolization are only used in the treatment of HMB secondary to fibroids. An oophorectomy is not a treatment of HMB

questions.q: Which syndrome describes intra uterine adhesions?
questions.explanation: Asherman syndrome is an acquired condition causing intra uterine adhesions and can be caused by surgery of the uterus, pelvic infections or treatment of cancer. It can also be a complication of manual vacuum aspiration

questions.q: What is the main presenting symptom of miscarriage?
questions.explanation: Vaginal bleeding is the main presenting symptom of miscarriage

questions.q: Which type of breech presentation is where both legs are flexed at the hips and the knees?
questions.explanation: Complete breech presents with both legs flexed at the hips and the knees

questions.q: Which condition produces a microcytic anemia?
questions.explanation: Iron deficiency can lead to microcytic anemia. Thalassemia, anemia of chronic disease, sideroblastic anemia, lead poisoning can all lead to microcytic anemia

questions.q: Which of the following is a common symptom of a cervical polyp?
questions.explanation: If symptomatic, the most common clinical feature is abnormal vaginal bleeding

questions.q: Which of the following is a direct complication of oligohydramnios?
questions.explanation: Oligohydramnios decreases the fetal ability to move in utero which can lead to the development of severe muscle contractures

questions.q: In a woman with drug-managed gestational diabetes, what are the recommendations for delivery?
questions.D: Allow the pregnancy to prolong and do not induce
questions.explanation: Women who have gestational diabetes should aim to deliver at 37-38 weeks if they are on pharmacological management. They would be advised to consider induction of labor or cesarean section before 40+6 weeks if they are managing gestational diabetes with diet alone

questions.q: What is the recommended treatment for anti-phospholipid syndrome during pregnancy?
questions.explanation: Live birth rate in women with anti-phospholipid syndrome who do not receive pharmacological intervention has been reported to be as low as 15%, so management with an anticoagulant and platelet agent is recommended. Warfarin is contraindicated in pregnancy due to its teratogenicity

questions.q: The Expected date of delivery of a human pregnancy can be calculated:
questions.A: From a change in the patient's weight.
questions.B: As 10 lunar months after the time of ovulation.
questions.C: As 40 weeks after last menstrual period.
questions.D: As 280 days from the last full moon.
questions.E: As 36 weeks after the last menstrual period.
questions.explanation: The EDD is calculated using Naegele’s rule: LMP - 3 months + 7 days

questions.q: The last menstrual period was June 30. The expected date of delivery (EDD) is approximately:
questions.explanation: Using Naegele’s rule

questions.q: Uterine Cervix:
questions.A: Is the portion of the uterus below the isthmus
questions.B: External OS cell lining is columnar epithelium
questions.C: Laterally is attached to the round ligament
questions.D: The cervical canal is covered with stratified squamous epithelium
questions.E: Can be dilated with dilators without the need of anesthesia
questions.explanation: Uterine cervix is the portion of the uterus below the isthmus

questions.q: The main support of the uterus is provided by:
questions.explanation: The cardinal ligament is the main support for the uterus

questions.q: The most important muscle in the pelvic floor is:
questions.explanation: Levator ani muscle is the most important muscle of the pelvic floor

questions.q: The pelvis includes which of the following bones:
questions.A: Trochanter, hip socket, ischium, sacrum & pubis.
questions.explanation: The pelvis is made up of ilium, ischium, pubis, sacrum, and coccyx

questions.q: The joint between the two pubic bones is called the:
questions.explanation: The joint between two pubic bones is called pubic symphysis

questions.q: The greatest diameter of the fetal head is:
questions.explanation: The biggest diameter of the fetal head is occipitomental

questions.q: Molding of the fetal head:
questions.B: Becomes progressively easier as gestational age increases
questions.D: Does NOT have time to occur in breech delivery
questions.E: Does not happen when the maternal pelvis is adequate
questions.explanation: Molding of the fetal head does not occur in breech delivery

questions.q: The main blood supply of the vulva is:
questions.explanation: The main blood supply of the vulva is the pudendal artery

questions.q: The following are typical in the female bony pelvis EXCEPT:
questions.A: Has a transverse diameter of the inlet greater than the antero-posterior diameter
questions.B: Has an obstetric conjugate of 11-12 cm
questions.D: Has an obtuse greater sciatic notch
questions.E: Has a pubic angle greater than 90 degrees
questions.explanation: Gynecoid is considered the most common female pelvis and it is round and open, not funnel-shaped

questions.q: Regarding fetal head, choose the CORRECT answer:
questions.A: Can be delivered vaginally in persistent occipito-mental presentation
questions.B: Will show Spalding's sign within 12 hours of intrauterine death
questions.C: Can be delivered vaginally in persistent brow presentation
questions.D: Is likely to be a vertex presentation when the head is deflexed
questions.E: Considered to be engaged when the biparietal diameter passes the level of the pelvic inlet

questions.q: The ovarian artery is a branch of:
questions.explanation: The ovarian artery is a branch of the abdominal aorta

questions.q: The normal lining of the fallopian tube is:
questions.explanation: The normal lining of the fallopian tube is columnar epithelium with cilia

questions.q: The cilia of the fallopian tube has the following function:
questions.A: Remove the zona pellucida which surrounds the ovum
questions.B: Transport the ovum towards the uterus
questions.C: Enhance the rapid division of the zygote
questions.D: Transport the ovum towards the peritoneal cavity
questions.E: Has a bactericidal function to prevent peritoneal infection
questions.explanation: The cilia of the fallopian tube is responsible for transporting the ovum towards the uterus

questions.q: What condition produces a macrocytic anemia?
questions.explanation: B12 and B9 deficiency can lead to a macrocytic anemia

questions.q: What is the upper gestational age limit for a pregnancy loss to be classified as a miscarriage?
Which of the following is a cause of polyhydramnios?
questions.explanation: Esophageal atresia prevents the fetus from swallowing amniotic fluid, leading to polyhydramnios

questions.q: What is the most common coagulopathy to cause heavy menstrual bleeding?
questions.explanation: Von Willebrand’s disease is the most common coagulopathy in women

questions.q: What is the correct definition of a secondary postpartum hemorrhage?
questions.C: Bleeding from 24 hours after delivery to 6 weeks postpartum
questions.D: Bleeding from 24 hours after delivery to 12 weeks postpartum
questions.explanation: Secondary postpartum hemorrhage is defined as excessive vaginal bleeding in the period from 24 hours after delivery to 12 weeks postpartum

questions.q: What is administered to prevent rhesus maternal isoimmunization?
questions.explanation: Anti-D immunoglobulin is administered to prevent rhesus isoimmunization

questions.q: Which of the following features is most strongly associated with cord prolapse?
questions.explanation: Occlusion and arterial vasospasm of the cord lead to hypoxia and fetal distress, which often presents as fetal bradycardia

questions.q: Why are cervical polyps routinely removed, even if asymptomatic?
questions.C: To prevent the spread of polyps
questions.D: They have a small risk of malignant transformation
questions.explanation: The risk of malignant transformation is less than 0.5%

questions.q: Which of the following is not part of Bishop's score?
What is the most common site of ectopic pregnancy?
questions.explanation: The ampulla end of the fallopian tube is the most common site for ectopic pregnancy

questions.q: What structure is the fetal station measured in relation to?
questions.explanation: Fetal station is measured in relation to the ischial spine

questions.q: Which of the following is an absolute contraindication to VBAC?
questions.explanation: Classical cesarean section is always an absolute contraindication for VBAC due to high risk of uterine rupture

questions.q: Acanthosis nigricans is a sign of PCOS, what is it?
questions.A: Tender red nodules that form in both shins
questions.D: Darkened, velvety hyperpigmentation of the skin
questions.explanation: Acanthosis nigricans is seen in PCOS

questions.q: Which of the following is a recognized risk factor for adenomyosis?
questions.explanation: Previous uterine surgery is a strong risk factor for adenomyosis

questions.q: How is oligohydramnios defined?
questions.explanation: Oligohydramnios refers to a low level of amniotic fluid during pregnancy. It is defined by an amniotic fluid index that is below the 5th centile for the gestational age

questions.q: Which of the following can occur as a consequence of fetal hyperinsulinemia?
questions.explanation: Due to the anabolic effect of insulin, we see macrosomia in fetuses exposed to a large amount of it

questions.q: Which of the following procedures is offered in a prolonged pregnancy?
questions.explanation: An induction of labor is offered first-line in a post-dates pregnancy. If the patient declines an induction, they should be offered twice-weekly monitoring

questions.q: Hyperextension of the fetal head is found in:
Stages of labor:
questions.A: The first stage commences at the time of membrane rupture
questions.B: The cervix dilates at a consistent rate of 3 cm per hour in the first stage
questions.C: The third stage ends with the delivery of the placenta and membranes
questions.D: Forceps or ventouse may be useful in slow progress of the late 1st stage
questions.E: Syntometrine is a combination of oxytocin and ergometrine, used in the treatment of secondary postpartum hemorrhage (PPH)
questions.explanation: The third stage of labor ends with the delivery of the placenta and membranes

questions.q: All the following characteristics are applied to a pelvis favorable to vaginal delivery EXCEPT:
questions.B: Obstetric conjugate is less than 10 cm
questions.E: Intertuberous diameter accepts 4 knuckles on pelvic exam

questions.q: In the fetus:
questions.A: The coronal suture lies between the two parietal bones
questions.B: The umbilical artery normally contains one artery and two veins
questions.C: Fetal lie describes the long axis of the fetus to the long axis of the mother
questions.D: Entanglement of the umbilical cord is common in diamniotic twins
questions.E: The anterior fontanelle is usually closed by the time of labor
questions.explanation: Fetal lie describes the long axis of the fetus to the long axis of the mother

questions.q: Which of the following terms best describes the pelvic type of small posterior sagittal diameter, convergent sidewalls, prominent ischial spines, and narrow pubic arch?
questions.explanation: Android pelvis has a small posterior sagittal diameter, convergent sidewalls, prominent ischial spines, and narrow pubic arch

questions.q: The second stage of labor involves:
questions.explanation: The second stage of labor ends with the expulsion of the fetus

questions.q: A pelvic inlet is felt to be contracted if:
questions.A: The anteroposterior diameter is only 12 cm
questions.B: The transverse diameter is only 10 cm
questions.E: The patient had a previous C-section

questions.q: At term, the ligaments of the pelvis change. This can result in:
questions.E: Posterior rotation of the levator muscles
questions.explanation: Enlargement of the pelvic cavity will help in the process of delivery

questions.q: During the delivery, the fetal head follows the pelvic axis. The axis is best described as:
questions.B: A curved line, first directed anteriorly then caudal
questions.C: A curved line, first directed posteriorly then caudal
questions.D: A curved line, first directed posteriorly then cephalic

questions.q: In a vertex presentation, the position is determined by the relationship of what fetal part to the mother's pelvis:
Signs of placental separation after delivery include:
questions.B: Changes of uterine shape from discoid to globular
questions.D: Presentation of the placenta at the cervical os
questions.explanation: All the above are signs of placental separation after delivery

questions.q: An unstable lie is related to all of the following EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Fundal fibroid is above where the fetus lies, though it can cause compression if it increases to a significantly larger size

questions.q: The relation of the fetal parts to one another determines:
The relationship of the long axis of the fetus to the long axis of the mother is called:
Engagement is strictly defined as:
questions.A: When the presenting part goes through the pelvic inlet
questions.B: When the presenting part is level with the ischial spines
questions.C: When the greatest biparietal diameter of the fetal head passes the pelvic inlet
questions.D: When the greatest biparietal diameter of the fetal head is at the level of ischial spines
questions.explanation: Engagement is when the greatest biparietal diameter of the fetal head passes the pelvic inlet

questions.q: The fetal head may undergo changes in shape during normal delivery. The most common etiology listed is:
questions.explanation: Molding helps in the delivery process and passage of the fetus through the pelvic area

questions.q: If the large fontanel is the presenting part, what is the presentation?
Methods of determining fetal presentation & position include:
questions.explanation: Leopold’s maneuver is used to determine the fetal presentation and position

questions.q: A transverse lie of the fetus is least likely in the presence of:
questions.explanation: A transverse lie is least likely seen in a normal term fetus

questions.q: A primipara is in labor and an episiotomy is to be cut. Compared with a midline episiotomy, an advantage of mediolateral episiotomy is:
A patient sustained a laceration of the perineum during delivery, it involved the muscles of the perineal body but not the anal sphincter. Such a laceration would be classified as:
Which of the following statements about episiotomy is FALSE:
questions.A: Median (midline) episiotomy is generally considered to be less painful than mediolateral episiotomy
questions.B: Mediolateral or lateral episiotomy may be associated with more blood loss than the median one
questions.C: Indications for episiotomy include avoiding an imminent perineal tear, the use of forceps, breech delivery, & the delivery of premature infants
questions.D: The earlier the episiotomy is done during delivery, generally the more beneficial it will be in speeding delivery
questions.E: Episiotomy incisions are repaired anatomically in layers
questions.explanation: Episiotomy is not done during delivery unless necessary

questions.q: The first stage of labor:
questions.D: Ends with full dilation of the cervix
questions.explanation: The first stage of labor ends with the full dilation of the cervix

questions.q: The heart rate of a normal fetus at term:
questions.E: There is no baseline heart rate
questions.explanation: Normal fetal heart rate is 120-160 bpm

questions.q: Repetitive late decelerations most commonly indicate:
questions.explanation: Repetitive late decelerations indicate fetal hypoxia

questions.q: Electronic fetal monitoring:
questions.A: Has high specificity but low sensitivity
questions.B: Has low specificity but high sensitivity

questions.q: What is the uterine blood flow at term:
questions.explanation: Increased uterine blood flow is observed at term

questions.q: The following are major indicators of fetal asphyxia:
questions.A: Old meconium at the time of induction of labor
questions.C: Deep type I deceleration in the second stage of labor

questions.q: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of normal labor:
questions.explanation: Moderate bleeding is not a feature of normal labor

questions.q: During which of the following conditions would the serum prolactin level be greatest:
questions.explanation: Prolactin stimulates the production of milk during breastfeeding

questions.q: Regarding prostaglandins:
questions.A: Maintain the corpus luteum of early pregnancy
questions.B: Have no role in the development of menorrhagia

questions.D: Have no role in the development of dysmenorrhea

questions.q: Early deceleration is:

questions.q: The bishop score is used to predict:

questions.explanation: The bishop score is used to predict the success rate of the induction of labor

questions.q: The volume of amniotic fluid:
questions.A: Is closely related to the fetal crown-rump length in the 3rd trimester of pregnancy
questions.C: Is reduced in severe rhesus disease
questions.explanation: Ultrasound is used to determine and predict the level of amniotic fluid using tools such as the amniotic fluid index

questions.q: Fetal nutrition is dependent on:
questions.explanation: Fetal nutrition depends on multiple factors such as maternal nutrient stores, maternal diet, placental exchange, and maternal metabolism

questions.q: Cephalopelvic disproportion in the absence of gross pelvic abnormality can be diagnosed by:

questions.q: Umbilical cord prolapse is associated with all the following, EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Anencephaly is not associated with umbilical prolapse

In patients with a bicornuate uterus when getting pregnant, all these complications can occur EXCEPT:
questions.explanation: Polyhydramnios is less likely to occur in these patients due to the anatomy of the uterus

questions.q: In Turner's syndrome:
questions.A: A chromosomal structure of 45 XY is characteristic

questions.A: Development of male genitalia depends on the presence of functioning testes and responsive end organs
questions.B: Due to the absence of testes, XX fetuses exposed to androgens in utero will NOT be masculinized

questions.q: Turner syndrome: Which is true?
questions.B: Has testis in the inguinal area
